Definition.WordDefinition:
Shortsighted \Short"sight`ed\, a. 1. Not able to see far; nearsighted; myopic. See {Myopic}, and {Myopia}. [1913 Webster]
2. Fig.: Not able to look far into futurity; unable to understand things deep; of limited intellect. [1913 Webster]
3. Having little regard for the future; heedless. [1913 Webster] -- {Short"sight`ed*ly}, adv. -- {Short"sight`ed*ness}, n. [1913 Webster]
Cunning is a kind of shortsightedness. --Addison. [1913 Webster]

shortsighted adj 1: lacking foresight or scope; "a short view of the problem"; "shortsighted policies"; "shortsighted critics derided the plan"; "myopic thinking" [syn: {short}, {unforesightful}, {myopic}] 2: not given careful consideration; "ill-considered actions often result in disaster"; "an ill-judged attempt" [syn: {ill-considered}, {ill-judged}, {improvident}]
